info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 12:41PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Noblesville.
White River near Nora.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River near Centerton.
...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Petersburg.
White River at Edwardsport.
White River at Hazleton.
.Significant and some major flooding is expected to develop along the White River due to several rounds of heavy rainfall through Sunday. Wednesday night rainfall of generally two to three inches fell across the White basin. Additional rainfall of three to five inches in the upper and middle White and five to seven inches in the lower White is expected through Sunday morning, and this is all included in today's forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Noblesville.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Water begins to flood Strawtown Avenue one mile northwest of Strawtown.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 11.7 feet early Saturday morning. It will rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon to 18.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 345 AM EDT /245 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
